cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the northern Yucatan today, then turning north and accelerating NNE across the Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi) by Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana near Morgan City–New Orleans area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL including Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, Vermilion, Pensacola and Mobile Bays.  Hurricane Watch: Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and metro New Orleans.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning currently only for Yucatan Peninsula coast from Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana through coastal Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible late Wednesday with a 25% chance of sustained 34-kt winds and a 7% chance of 50-kt winds at the port; gusts could reach 40–50 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port location, though lower Mississippi River levels could briefly rise due to down-bay surge.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely, isolated amounts up to 6 inches leading to flash or urban flooding around the terminal complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and possible short-term river flooding that could disrupt cargo and landside transportation.
